title: Read respirometry data
text: recommend keeping analysis scripts data project (doesn’t mean folder), use great package package manage files (see documentation learn ). First, ’ll let R know project root folder. data lives funky place (constraints R package), giving file paths easy. Great, now file paths. function needs know things. Takes either "free" "fixed". column contains time stamps either seconds datetime format (takes either column number name quotes, e.g. 4 "time") can actual sampling rate, use information bin observations, can easily choose lower sampling rate. value optional, provided used convert spatial estimates unit-less centimeters. Can found computer mice. Let’s try read provided files:
code: library(here, quietly = TRUE) #> here() starts at /home/runner/work/respirometr/respirometr here::i_am("vignettes/articles/read-licor.Rmd") #> here() starts at /home/runner/work/respirometr/respirometr filepath_1 <- here("tests", "data", "li850.txt")  # These might be something like: here("data", "trackball", "sensor_1", "trackballdata_100.csv") for you! df <- read_licor(   filepath_1 ) #> Rows: 1713 Columns: 11 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "\t" #> dbl  (8): x4_71616, x1_19802, x2_06536e1, x5_15667e1, x9_92875e1, x1_4041066... #> lgl  (1): x #> date (1): x2024_10_07 #> time (1): x10_44_50 #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
